pr_title: fix: Make refreshing channel compatible with BigtableDataClientFactory

timeline.message: Make refreshing channel compatible with BigtableDataClientFactory

timeline.body:
```suggestion
        Preconditions.checkArgument(
            appProfileId != null, "refreshingChannel only works when appProfileId is set");
              BigtableChannelPrimer.create(
                  getCredentialsProvider().getCredentials(),
                  projectId,
                  instanceId,
                  appProfileId,
                  primedTableIds));
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
Preconditions.checkArgument(appProfileId != null,
"refreshingChannel only works when appProfileId is set");
InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider.Builder channelProviderBuilder =
((InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider) getTransportChannelProvider()).toBuilder();
Preconditions.checkArgument(
appProfileId != null, "refreshingChannel only works when appProfileId is set");
BigtableChannelPrimer.create(
getCredentialsProvider().getCredentials(),
projectId,
instanceId,
appProfileId,
primedTableIds));

timeline.author: kolea2

timeline.body:
Please add comment, something along the lines of:

Channel refreshing only needs to be configured on the shared ClientContext, derivative clients don't have the ability to reconfigure the refresh logic
timeline.bodyText:
Please add comment, something along the lines of:
Channel refreshing only needs to be configured on the shared ClientContext, derivative clients don't have the ability to reconfigure the refresh logic

timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.body:
I think there is a subtle bug here:

If the original CredentialsProvider was a GoogleCredentialsProvider then each time getCredentials is called, it will be a new instance, which means the credentials used for refreshing will diverge from the normal request credentials.

I think you need to wrap reset the credentials to be FixedCredentials here. 

Also please move the getCredentials line into its own try/catch its kinda hard to see which line can throw the IOException
timeline.bodyText:
I think there is a subtle bug here:
If the original CredentialsProvider was a GoogleCredentialsProvider then each time getCredentials is called, it will be a new instance, which means the credentials used for refreshing will diverge from the normal request credentials.
I think you need to wrap reset the credentials to be FixedCredentials here.
Also please move the getCredentials line into its own try/catch its kinda hard to see which line can throw the IOException
timeline.bodyHTML:
I think there is a subtle bug here:

If the original CredentialsProvider was a GoogleCredentialsProvider then each time getCredentials is called, it will be a new instance, which means the credentials used for refreshing will diverge from the normal request credentials.

I think you need to wrap reset the credentials to be FixedCredentials here.

Also please move the getCredentials line into its own try/catch its kinda hard to see which line can throw the IOException
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: To add here, can we add a test to ensure the credentials are consistent?
replies.author: kolea2

replies.bodyText: Updated BigtableDataClientFactoryTest.testCreateWithRefreshingChannel test to verify that getCredentials is only called once by the credentialProvider we set (similar to test testNewClientsShareTransportChannel.testNewClientsShareTransportChannel). Also added a test in EnhancedBigtableStubSettingsTest to make sure it's returning the same credentials.
replies.author: mutianf
